name: Mile End's Roast Beef with Pickled Horseradish
description: Anyone with any familiarity with the Mile End Deli knows that they take their smoked meat seriously. Noah and Rae Bernamoff offer detailed directions for re-creating their specialty in The Mile End Cookbook, but as a city-dweller who lacks a proper smoking set-up, I wanted to explore another one of their deli meats. Their Roast Beef is just as versatile as the smoked version, and the recipe couldn't be easier: season the roast, stick it in a hot, hot oven for 30 minutes or so, and then turn off the heat and let the meat cook through in the slowly cooling oven.
recipeYield: serves 6 to 8 as an entree; 12 to 15 as sandwiches
recipeIngredient: 1 7-pound beef top round roast or eye round roast
Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees. Rub the beef all over with oil and sprinkle it very generously with salt and pepper. Place the beef in a roasting pan fitted with a rack and cook for 1 hour for rare. If using an eye round, roast for only 30 minutes. Then, without opening the oven door, turn off the heat and let the roast continue to cook for another hour or so, until a thermometer inserted into the center of the roast reads 120 degrees. Let cool for 1 hour. Slice as thinly as possible and serve with horseradish.
